alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 12:19AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Marshall and DeKalb Counties through 100 AM CST... At 1218 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms from 10 miles northeast of Little River Falls to near McLarty. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albertville, Fort Payne, Boaz, Guntersville, Rainsville, Crossville, Sylvania, Fyffe, Geraldine and Douglas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms are showing brief broad rotation and may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for northeastern Alabama.
